com.generalnegentropics.archis.universe.environmentalconditions
Class Landscape2D

java.lang.Object
  com.generalnegentropics.archis.universe.environmentalconditions.Landscape2D
All Implemented Interfaces:
Condition, EnvironmentalCondition, IOHandler
public class Landscape2D
extends java.lang.Object
implements EnvironmentalCondition

Implements a two-dimensional landscape with cell-cell interaction.

Version:
3.0
Author:
Adam Ierymenko

initImageLandscape

public void initImageLandscape(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)

Initializes a featured lanscape based on an image

Black areas of the image will be empty cells, while any non-black areas will be set as solid impassable blocks.

Parameters:
image - Image to initialize from

getInternalLandscapeContents

public java.lang.Object getInternalLandscapeContents(int x,
                                                     int y)

Returns internal landscape contents object

This is only useful if you know the internals of this class and to write very fast browsers and visualization components for the landscape.

This should probably not be used by third party developers who don't have the source, as what is returned by this function is not guaranteed to stay consistent between program versions.

Parameters:
x - X location
y - Y location
Returns:
Internal contents of landscape

addEnergy

public void addEnergy(int x,
                      int y,
                      int energy)
Adds energy at a given location, feeding it to a cell if a cell is there or discarding if the location is blocked.

Parameters:
x - X location
y - Y location
energy - Energy value

energyToAdd - Energy to add
density - Maximum amount of energy to add per x,y location

postTickProcessCells

public void postTickProcessCells(java.util.List cells)
Description copied from interface: Condition

Called in each thread to process batches of cells concurrently post-tick

(Called before postTickNotify())

The List given as the parameter is not modifiable. Note that anything done here must be synchronized as the whole point of this method is to enable multithreaded post-tick processing within conditions. Also note that this will be called for each thread, and so might be called more than once on multi-CPU machines. Do things that must be done only once in postTickNotify.

Specified by:
postTickProcessCells in interface Condition
Parameters:
cells - List of cells to process

preExecutionNotify

public void preExecutionNotify(Cell l)
Description copied from interface: Condition

Called before each cell execution

This method may kill the cell, and this will prevent execution but will not prevent preExecutionNotify from being called for other cells. When doing other things, alive() should be checked in the cell first to save processing time.

Specified by:
preExecutionNotify in interface Condition
Parameters:
l - Cell to create input for
